title.narrative: 1.6.3 TECH. & MANAGERIAL CAPACITY DEV.

description.narrative: By 2016, 25% LGIs in the programme areas have the technical and managerial capacity to implement integrated Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) interventions and take appropriate measures to ensure safety and sustainability of drinking water, which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2016, women, children and youth in 20 selected districts, demand and benefit from increased and more equitable utilization of quality health, nutrition, population, education, water, sanitation and HIV services

sector.narrative: Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Water - climate resilience and environmental sustainability
Water supply - rural communities service delivery

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, 25% LGIs in the programme areas have the technical and managerial capacity to implement integrated WASH interventions andtake appropriate measures to ensure safety and sustainability of drinking water

description.narrative: UNICEF Bangladesh support contributed to increased capacity of national and sub-national institutions responsible for WASH services, enabling them to deliver and scale up those services, develop plans to implement and monitor integrated WASH services, and complete equity assessments to ensure safety and sustainability of drinking water. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: Number of LGIs which have increased budget allocation for WASH interventions

actual.value: 2016:12 LGIs increased budget allocation for WASH interventions

title.narrative: Number of LGIs which have carried out WASH equity assessments in the programme area

actual.value: 2016:28 LGIs completed WASH equity assessment using MoRES

title.narrative: Number of LGIs in the programme area which have the capacity to develop, implement and monitor Integrated WASH Plans

actual.value: 2016:60 LGIs acquired capacity to develop, implement and monitor integrated WASH plans

title.narrative: Number of LGIs with increased technical and managerial capacity to plan, implement and monitor WASH interventions

actual.value: 2016:60 LGIs had increased technical and managerial capacity to plan, implement and monitor WASH interventions
